entry.title: Re: üîê Strengthening SAP BTP Security: SSO with Cloud Connector Using Token-Based Auth (Replacing SU
entry.content:
Hi @MatthiasL ,

Considering below scenarios:

  • Segregation of Duties and restricted privileges to different teams. If you see the screenshots, you will observe that i am using Trust Config "Custom Identity provider for Applications" - IAS for authentication, What it means is It's a subaccount level trust configuraiton (Not the Platform SSO). Which implies that the user CloudConnectorAdmin which i used will never be able to login to BTP cockpit and see the configurations in BTP subaccount ->cloud connector section to download the authentication data file. 
    • Permissions(cloud connector administrator) are also provided against this identity provider only. Even if let's say some customer has platform SSO enabled and luckily same user is used to login to BTP cockpit. Subaccount will still not be visible because of the permissions which are granted on Custom IDP for Apps and not on Platform SSO IDP(which will be used to login to BTP).
    • We can restrict privileges of users to perform specific tasks. In this scenario CloudConnectorAdmin can perform the connectivity , renew certificates and still don't have any access in BTP subaccount(because it can't login using these creds to BTP)..
  • This option was introduced in Cloud Connector 2.17.0  version. There are a lot of customers using older versions of cloud connector and don't have this option.

However its a valid point and this option also helps avoiding SUSER ID option so i have updated the blog with a small section to show this option as well - "Configure using authentication data from file"

Regards

Sushil Gupta

entry.title: Error occurred while integrating SAP GRDC with S4HANA for Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

We‚Äôve successfully created a Subaccount for SAP GRDC and established trust with the respective tenant. All relevant roles have been assigned to ABCD ID, and the destination for GRDC has also been configured.

However, during the connection test, we‚Äôre encountering a 302 error. 

In S4HANA Side :

We have created Communication User, Communication System and Communication Arrangement (SAP_COMM_0241).We are referring the SAP Document for this (Step 7).


But while we click on Manage Packages, we are getting  this error :

Can't get the global parameters from the SAP S/4HANA system. Can't retrieve the definition for destinations S4HanaCConsoEndpoint or S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_RFC: Failed to read authentication token of destination 'S4HanaCConsoEndpoint'. The destination service responded with an error: 'Provided authorization grant is invalid. Exception was No user found with alias 'ABCD@xyz.com' (format: unspecified). For more information, consult the kernel traces or the OAuth 2.0 trouble shooting SAP note 1688545'. In case only the properties of a destination should be accessed, without performing authorization flows, please use the 'getDestinationProperties' method on 'DestinationService' instead..


FUNCTIONAL_EXCEPTION Can't retrieve the definition for destinations S4HanaCConsoEndpoint or S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_RFC: Failed to read authentication token of destination 'S4HanaCConsoEndpoint'. The destination service responded with an error: 'Provided authorization grant is invalid. Exception was No user found with alias 'ABCD@xyz.com' (format: unspecified). For more information, consult the kernel traces or the OAuth 2.0 trouble shooting SAP note 1688545'. In case only the properties of a destination should be accessed, without performing authorization flows, please use the 'getDestinationProperties' method on 'DestinationService' instead.

While we click on Define Data Mapping :
We got this error (Can't load the metadata from the SAP S/4HANA system.
Contact your system administrator with this log ID: )

This issue is blocking further progress, and resolving it is critical due to multiple dependencies.

Please help us with this.

Thanks in advance.

Antra Ansari

entry.title: Re: Serial Number in Storage Bin Location
entry.content:
Hello @Charisma_fitra 

Legacy stock lacking serial numbers cannot be converted.

To separate it, you can either:

  • Move it into a different storage location to keep it apart from new SN-managed stock, or
  • Post a goods issue and then re-receipt it with serial numbers.

This ensures clear separation between old and new stock.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Error occurred while integrating SAP GRDC with S4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

The error you are experiencing relates to the OAuth 2.0 trust configuration and destination alias mapping between your SAP BTP subaccount hosting GRDC and your SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud  tenant. A 302 redirect or the no user found with alias message suggests that although the destination can access the S/4HANA system, the problem lies in the identity alias mapping during authentication.

Key Checks to Troubleshoot This Issue.

Communication Setup in SAP S/4HANA:

    • Make sure that the communication scenario SAP_COM_0241 (Consolidation ‚Äì Data Collection Integration) is created.
    • The relevant Communication User must be actively engaged and properly assigned.
    • Authentication method should be set to OAuth 2.0, not Basic Authentication.

Trust Setup Between BTP and S/4HANA:

    • In your SAP BTP subaccount, under Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration, verify that the S/4HANA tenant is trusted as an Identity Provider.
    • Verify that the user alias SAP@HANA.com exists and is mapped correctly to an S/4 user.
    • On the S/4HANA side, verify the Business User maintenance to ensure the user ID and email are consistent and linked to the Communication User.

Destination Configuration in SAP BTP Cockpit:

    • Verify that destinations like S4HanaCConsoEndpoint and S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_RFC use authentication type OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion.
    • Confirm the Token Service URL Type is set to Dedicated.
    • Ensure the audience and client ID match exactly with the S/4HANA Communication System settings.
    • Test the connection from the BTP Cockpit to verify metadata retrieval.

Role assignments in SAP S/4HANA Cloud:

    • The Communication User must have roles that permit Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) API calls, such as the SAP_FIN_BC_CONS_TMC_PC catalogue assigned through Maintain Business Roles.

Frequent mistake:
The message No user found with alias usually indicates that the alias configured in the destination cannot be found in the S/4HANA Identity Provider. Make sure the alias/email matches exactly as propagated from BTP to S/4HANA.

For detailed configuration, please refer to the official SAP Help on Configure Communication Management for GRDC Integration.

KBA 1688545 ‚Äì OAuth 2.0 Troubleshooting Guide 

Setting up an SAP Best Practices Integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

Please inform me if you require any further assistance or support.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: "Build work zone, standard subscription" creation error on BTP Trial account.
entry.content:
I have a BTP trial account. I need to have "Build work zone, standard subscription" to manage my ABAP backend and consume RAP API with Expressjs. Because I need a communication scenario (inbound and authorization) available in Launchpad which can be configured in Build Work Zone normally. To have a Build Work Zone subscription when I click to create and then standard subscription, getting this error: 

You haven't configured your subaccount (for business users) to trust a tenant of SAP Cloud Identity Services using OpenID Connect. SAML trust isn't supported for this service. To subscribe this application, use the Establish Trust option to configure trust between your subaccount and SAP Cloud Identity Services.

I have just default identity provider as user and in Trust Configuration I find just one record which includes name: Default Identity Provider protocol: OpenID Connect. There are no other Trust in this section.

I have read about migration of SAML to OpenID Connect, but I don't see any SAML Trust above mentioned and thus no Tenant names are there. (I tried also a SAML Trust to create but it requires choosing tenant).

Just want to consume some data from a backend. That's all. It shouldn't be that hard. I did this before in NodeJs many times, also in other technologies.

Any help, recommendation appreciated. Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Calling SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 API from SAP Build: A Quick Fix Guide
entry.content:
Hey folks,

Just wanted to share a quick post about a recent issue I ran into while working with SAP Build Actions and SAP AI Core‚Äôs Orchestration v2 API ‚Äî specifically the completion endpoint. This will be a short and to-the-point blog post for anyone hitting similar roadblocks trying to configure an action in SAP Build to call this API.

Let me break it down into three parts:

1. The Problem

I was trying to configure an SAP Build action to call the /completion method from the SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 API.

Now, normally this is quite straightforward ‚Äî just grab the API specification JSON file from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub and upload it using the SAP Build wizard. But in this case, things didn‚Äôt go as planned.

Here‚Äôs what happened:

  • The completion method didn‚Äôt show up in the wizard.
  • I tried uploading the API spec file manually ‚Äî this time it showed the method. Great!
  • But once I used the provided example from the API doc to test it, I got hit with a 400 error üòë



2. Why the Standard Way Doesn‚Äôt Work

Turns out, the schema and the example JSON in the API documentation don‚Äôt match. So even though the wizard technically accepts the API file, SAP Build complains when you try to use the provided example.

From what I observed, it looks like the schema or example might have been copied from v1 or has some leftover data that doesn‚Äôt match v2 requirements. Either way ‚Äî we‚Äôre stuck unless we intervene manually.

3. The Fix: Manual Configuration & Correct Payload

Since I couldn‚Äôt rely on the official schema and example, I took a more DIY approach.

Step 1: Clean up the payload

First, I stripped down the example JSON to just the mandatory fields to pass SAP Build‚Äôs schema validation. That helped temporarily, but when I actually hit the API, I got a new error saying:

"Missing required field: orchestration_config"

So, clearly the schema itself was also incomplete.

‚ùóQuick Detour: Tried AI Launchpad for Help

At this point, I thought of checking the SAP AI Launchpad in BTP to get the real orchestration configuration JSON. That would be the natural place to find the actual payload, right?

But unfortunately, the orchestration config shown in AI Launchpad of subaccount is identical to what was already in the API specification file ‚Äî so no luck there either. üòÖ


Step 2: Find a correct schema

Luckily, I found this tutorial which had a bruno_collection file. I searched for the completion method and found the json schema with the orchestration_config keyword included.

 


Here's a snippet:

{
  "orchestration_config": {
    "module_configurations": {
      "grounding_module_config": {
        ...
      },
      ...
    }
  },
  "input_params": {
    "groundingRequest": "what is joule?"
  },
  "return_module_results": true
}


Step 3: Configure SAP Build

At this point, you can either remove the action and

  • Build from scratch
  • Or continue with the existing action and replace the faulty input key with the corrected one


If you face a similar issue with output structure, you can follow the same logic ‚Äî update the output schema manually to match the real response you‚Äôre getting.

And finally‚Ä¶ üí•

It works! üéâ


Final Thoughts

So, if you‚Äôre trying to call the SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 /completion API from SAP Build and the standard flow isn‚Äôt working ‚Äî don‚Äôt worry. It‚Äôs not you, it‚Äôs the schema üòâ

You‚Äôll likely need to:

  • Skip the API wizard
  • Use the correct payload from the tutorial
  • Manually configure your action with fixed request and response schemas

Let me know in the comments if you ran into the same issue or found a better workaround! I‚Äôd love to learn how you approached it too.

Thanks for reading üôå

entry.title: Re: "Build work zone, standard subscription" creation error on BTP Trial account.
entry.content:
I really lost what you are trying to achieve when you said that you want to use "Build work zone, standard subscription" to manage my ABAP backend and consume RAP API with Expressjs and later when you say " I need a communication scenario (inbound and authorization) available in Launchpad" and finally "Just want to consume some data from a backend. (...) I did this before in NodeJs many times, also in other technologies." 

Reading this makes me wonder if you know that Work Zone standard edition will offer you. It's only a launchpad in BTP. There is no management of ABAP or consumption of APIs using Express or any inbound communication. 

But let's go for the facts.

  • Using a the identity provider is possible (however not recommended)
  • Using a custom identity provider is possible with both SAML and OpenID
  • It's possible to migrate a custom IdP using SAML to OpenID

I'd recommend sharing a little bit more how your trust configuration looks like, how you are trying to create the subscription.

Something important is if you have already a subscription of the Work Zone advanced edition in the same BTP subaccount. Up until recently this was a not recommended and recently I've seen somewhere it should not be an issue anymore but I personally doubt that. The advanced edition works only with a custom IdP.

entry.title: Re: Push notifications using SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi James/Vladyslav,

Quick follow-up - have either of you successfully enabled push notifications in SAP Build Apps (not MDK/Fiori)? If yes, could you please share step-by-step details? I‚Äôve been trying for months and keep hitting roadblocks.

For context:

  • When I enable Mobile Services, the generated services does not have Push capability and  SAP support has told me this can‚Äôt be enabled for Build Apps.

  • Even on standalone builds, I‚Äôm prompted to enable Mobile Services, and I‚Äôm unclear whether FCM/APNs is actually supported end-to-end with Build Apps.

If you‚Äôve made this work, could you please outline:

  1. Environment & Build

    • iOS, Android, or both?

    • Standalone build (APK/IPA via TestFlight) vs. Preview app.

    • Exact Build Apps runtime/plugin versions used.

  2. Firebase/APNs Setup

    • FCM project config (google-services.json / GoogleService-Info.plist).

    • APNs keys/certificates and provisioning profiles for iOS.

    • Where/how you injected these into the Build Apps project.

  3. Build Apps Configuration

    • Marketplace plugins used (names/versions) for notifications.

    • Any Custom Plugin steps (config.xml, Gradle, Info.plist edits).

    • Logic flow you used: Request Permission ‚Üí Get Token ‚Üí Persist Token.

    • Whether Mobile Services was enabled, and if so, which features.

  4. Token & Backend

    • How you retrieved and stored the device token (BTP CF app, DB, Firebase, etc.).

    • How you send pushes (FCM HTTP v1 / APNs) ‚Äî sample request payloads helpful.

    • Any security (service accounts, OAuth) specifics.

entry.title: Production process
entry.content:
Good morning,
I have a question about how to carry out the following process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition.
Can you help me recommend the best practice for the following scenario?

1.The customer has rods in this example they identified as V001X6000M.

2.The complete rod measures 6 meters.

 

3.However, the customer sells the rod according to the measurement requested by the customer, and can sell the complete rod as "n" measurement requested by the customer.

4.For example, a client requires 1 meter, currently in his system he outputs the code V001X6000M which has the 6 meters and enters two new codes V001X1000M (the measurement requested from the client) and V001X5000M (the excess of the rod that can be reused).

5. The client wants to carry out this process using the PRODUCTION process, but I'm encountering several limitations.
For example, their bill of materials, if I handle the product in either PIECES OR METERS, let's say my customer order is for two pieces measuring 2 meters each.

When creating my production order, the system will create an order for two pieces of V001X6000M when in reality, one piece is sufficient because it measures 6 meters.

What have you recommended in this type of scenario, how to implement this process in SAP?
Have you implemented it in the production module?
Or is this type of scenario not recommended for production?

The option I'm considering is to manage batches. This way, I would output one batch with a 6m measurement and input two new batches with the new measurements, in order to reduce the creation of materials in SAP. The base unit of measurement that I am recommending is PIECE and in batch specify the measurement, in this way you will be able to know the quantity of pieces with the exact measurement that the batch number will be indicating.

I would greatly appreciate your comments if you have any additional suggestions.

Thank you so much.

entry.title: Re: Statistical Projects in SAP PS
entry.content:
The best practice for a purely "statistical" project is to use WBS elements only.  Network Activities cannot be set as Statistical, only WBS can be set Statistical.

Think of it like this, when you post an actual P&L cost you must assign it to a "real" cost object and in parallel you can also assign the cost to a statistical object.  WBS, Internal Orders, or Cost Centers can be set as statistical.

You can use Budget Availability Control with a Statistical WBS.

entry.title: How to get threshold value details per metric then send to Outbound Integration?
entry.content:
Dear support, we are searching for information if there is method to easily get threshold values per metric that raised an alert into outbound integration with badi enh ( eg. IF_ACC_MEA -> methods GET_....)


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to get threshold value details per metric then se...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Thank you for reaching out.

Upon further review, I would like to clarify that the interface `IF_ACC_MEA` does not provide a standard method to retrieve metric threshold details associated with the alerts. You can refer to page 14 of the guide linked below, which outlines all the supported out-of-the-box Get methods:  

https://support.sap.com/content/dam/support/en_us/library/ssp/alm/sap-solution-manager/focused-solutions/FocusedRun-Alert-Consumer-BAdI-Interface.pdf  

To access the threshold data, you will need to implement custom code. The following resources can assist you in identifying where these threshold details are stored:  

  1. For a specific Managed Object and metric, obtain the MO ID and Metric ID by referring to KBA 2515250, which is also applicable to FRUN.  
  2. Using the MO ID and Metric ID, retrieve the threshold type (`RULE_TYPE`) from the table `ACRULETYPESDIR`.  
  3. With the threshold type, run transaction SE80->package: AI_SOLMAN_ALRT_CFG_RULETYPES->Dictionary objects->database tables:
       - `ACALREADYRATED` ‚Äì "Already Rated" rule configuration  
       - `ACBESTOFLASTN` ‚Äì "Best of last n" rule configuration  
       - `ACCOUNTERTHRESH` ‚Äì Counter threshold  
       - `ACDELTATHRESH` ‚Äì Delta threshold  
       - `ACPCTHRESDIR` ‚Äì Alert configuration: database table for percentage threshold  
       - `ACRANGETHRESHDIR` ‚Äì Database table for range threshold configuration data  
       - `ACSIMPLETHRESDIR` ‚Äì Alert configuration: database table for simple thresholds  
       - `ACTEXTTHRESHOLD` ‚Äì Rule type text threshold  
       - `ACTHRESHOLDLESS` ‚Äì Threshold less rule configuration  

These tables contain further details on the specific thresholds, including numeric values and associated texts. 

Best regards,

Ava

SAP Support

entry.title: Tracking customer-owned RMAs in ECC
entry.content:
I am a user, not an architect. We are still running an older version of ECC with a roadmap to begin kick off our S4 HANA project in 2026. 

I have an urgent need for ideas how to track Customer-owned RMAs in our current version of SAP.  

Once goods receipt is performed, we can move it in MIGO with 311E movement type. The issue we have: the material is repaired in a plant different than the GR is performed. I want to track the physical location of the RMA in SAP while moved between plants. My IT group does not have a solution to move Customer-owned material across plants. 

Anyone have ideas how to track this material across plants that will not require huge amounts of IT resources, otherwise it will get pushed to the S4 project?

Also, does S4 Hana have a solution for this? 

Thanks in advance

Cost Center Splitting Weights Integrated Financial Planning
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone please guide me on how we obtain the % splitting weight in the Operating Expense Cost Center Splitting Weights ‚Üí Operating Expense Planning ‚Üí Administration tab?

I‚Äôm unable to understand how the percentages (e.g., 80% and 20%) are derived against the cost center activity type. From what I see, the calculation uses a restricted measure labeled Subtotal Driver 2, which is then referenced in the % Splitting Weight calculated measure.

However, when I add this restricted measure (Subtotal Driver 2) to a story table and simply edit the story measure (even without changing any parameters, keeping it exactly as is), the value changes.

Why does this happen, and how can we ensure the value remains constant (e.g., 50%)?

When I edit the measure without making any changes ‚Äî keeping in mind that this is standard content ‚Äî the value still changes.

when I click on ok.. values get changed 

please guide

entry.title: Testing in an SAP system under cloud environments:
entry.content:
1. Unit Testing
Also called: Component Testing / Program-Level Validation
Conducted by ABAP developers, functional consultants, or key technical experts to verify the correctness of individual programs, Fiori apps, custom objects, or reports in isolation.
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public & Private), this includes OData services, CDS views, and custom extensions built in SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

2. Integration Testing
Also called: End-to-End Process Validation / Cross-Module Testing
Confirms that interlinked processes across modules (e.g., FI ‚Üî MM ‚Üî SD ‚Üî PP) function seamlessly without data or process breaks.
In cloud environments, also covers integration with external systems (Ariba, SuccessFactors, Concur, 3rd-party APIs) using SAP Cloud Integration Suite.

3. Regression Testing
Also called: Change Impact Testing / Functional Stability Check
Ensures that existing functionality remains unaffected after configuration changes, upgrades, hotfixes, or quarterly SAP S/4HANA Cloud releases.
Often automated in cloud environments using SAP Cloud ALM, CBTA, or Tricentis Test Automation.

4. User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
Also called: Business Validation Testing / Operational Sign-Off
Conducted by business process owners and key users to verify that real-life business scenarios (not just test cases) run as expected.
In cloud projects, UAT often aligns with Fit-to-Standard workshops to confirm process readiness before go-live.

5. Performance Testing
Also called: Load & Stress Testing / Scalability Testing
Evaluates system responsiveness, stability, and throughput under peak load conditions.
In cloud, this may involve testing Fiori app response times, background job execution, API throughput, and SAP BTP extension performance.

6. Security Testing
Also called: Authorization Validation / Access Control Testing
Verifies roles, authorizations, segregation of duties (SoD), and access restrictions according to business compliance policies.
In S/4HANA Cloud, this includes Business Role Templates, Identity Authentication Service (IAS), and Identity Provisioning Service (IPS) configurations.

7. Build Verification Testing
Also called: Sanity Check
A quick, high-level validation to confirm that critical system functions are working after a new transport, upgrade, or cloud release before deeper testing.
In public cloud, this is crucial post-release due to SAP‚Äôs quarterly upgrade cycles.

8. Data Migration Testing
Also called: Data Conversion Validation / Legacy-to-Cloud Data Verification
Ensures complete, accurate, and loss-free data transfer from legacy systems to SAP S/4HANA via tools like SAP Migration Cockpit or Data Services.
Covers data cleansing, mapping validation, reconciliation reports, and post-load functional validation to ensure business processes work with migrated data.

entry.title: Re: They are so happy for her to be in a few days later a...
Re: GRC FireFighter error password change
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your reply.

I have now solved the problem. It wasn't actually due to the system parameters for the passwords, but rather the user type. It had accidentally been changed to ‚Äúsystem‚Äù instead of ‚Äúservice‚Äù for some of the FF IDs.

 

Best regards
Marco
